fdaDrugLabel.indication: HOMEOPATHIC INDICATIONS: For temporary relief of symptoms related to food allergies including swelling of the lips, stomach cramps, vomiting, occasional diarrhea, and skin rashes .** **These statements are based upon homeopathic principles. They have not been reviewed by the Food and Drug Administration.

nciThesaurus.definition: Tea derived from the dried leaves of the plant Camellia sinensis with potential antioxidant, chemopreventive, and lipid-lowering activities. Green tea contains polyphenols that are believed to be responsible for its chemopreventive effect. The polyphenol fraction contains mainly Epigallocatechin-3-gallate (EGCG) and other catechins, such as epicatechin (EC), gallocatechin gallate (GCG), epigallocatechin (EGC), and epicatechin gallate (ECG). Green tea polyphenols act as antioxidants and free radical scavengers and may affect enzymes involved in cellular replication and tumor angiogenesis by modulating angiogenic factors, such as vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF).
